revision.text:
{{Infobox Officeholder |name=Fahrettin Özdilek |office=[[Prime Minister of Turkey]]
{{small|[[List of Prime Ministers of Turkey|Interim]]}} |term_start=30 October 1961 |term_end=20 November 1961 |predecessor=[[Cemal Gürsel]] |successor=[[İsmet İnönü]] |birth_date=1898 |birth_place=[[Bursa|Bursa, Turkey]] |death_date=13 March 1989 |death_place=[[Ankara|Ankara, Turkey]] |allegiance={{flagcountry|Turkey}} |branch=[[Turkish Army]] |rank=[[General (military)|General]] |battles=[[Turkish War of Independence]] *[[Greco-Turkish War (1919-1922)]] }} '''Emin Fahrettin Özdilek''' was a military officer and politician. He served as acting Prime Minister of [[Turkey]] in 1961.{{cite web|url=http://www.terra.es/personal2/monolith/turkey.htm|title=Leaders of Turkey|publisher=Terra.es|accessdate=2011-09-08}} ==Military career== Özdilek entered cadet school in 1916. He was promoted to [[Lieutenant]] the following year.{{cite web|url=http://translate.googleusercontent.com/translate_c?hl=en&prev=/search%3Fq%3DEmin%2BFahrettin%2B%25C3%2596zdilek%252BTurkey%26start%3D10%26hl%3Den%26sa%3DN%26biw%3D1024%26bih%3D677%26prmd%3Divns&rurl=translate.google.com&sl=tr&u=http://www.turkcebilgi.com/emin_fahrettin_%25C3%25B6zdilek/ansiklopedi&usg=ALkJrhjAUMuIOqGekDraDdBeq9HacXHDaw|title=Emin Fahrettin Özdilek|publisher=Türkçe Bilgi|accessdate=2011-09-08}} Özdilek would later participate in the [[Turkish War of Independence]], including in the [[Greco-Turkish War (1919-1922)]]. He was promoted to [[General (military)|General]] in 1959. He was [[List of Commanders of the First Army of Turkey|Commander of the First Army of Turkey]] (August 1958 to June 1960). ==Political career== Özdilek became Defense Minister, State Minister and [[Deputy Prime Minister of Turkey|Deputy Prime Minister]] in 1960 after the Turkish military organized the May [[1960 Turkish coup d'état]] and overthrew the government of [[Adnan Menderes]]. The following year, he became acting Prime Minister during military control of Turkey after the previous Prime Minister, [[Cemal Gürsel]], became President. He held the position until the government was once again under civilian control with [[İsmet İnönü]] as Prime Minister. Later, he served in the [[Senate of the Republic (Turkey)|Senate of the Republic]] and the [[Grand National Assembly of Turkey]]. In the first session of the 1983 parliament, he assumed the temporary leadership of the new parliament during the ceremonies and the election of the new parliament chairman. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Prime Ministers of Turkey}} {{Ministers of the Interior of Turkey}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ozdilek, Emin}} [[Category:1898 births]] [[Category:1989 deaths]] [[Category:People from Bursa]] [[Category:People's Party (Turkey) politicians]] [[Category:Prime Ministers of Turkey]] [[Category:Deputy Prime Ministers of Turkey]] [[Category:Ministers of National Defence of Turkey]] [[Category:Ministers of the Interior of Turkey]] [[Category:Members of the Senate of the Republic (Turkey)]] [[Category:Deputies of Konya]] [[Category:Turkish Army generals]] [[Category:Commanders of the First Army of Turkey]] [[Category:Turkish military personnel of the Greco-Turkish War (1919–22)]] [[Category:Members of the 24th government of Turkey]] [[Category:Members of the 25th government of Turkey]]
